message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study uses data from the World Bank's Enterprise Survey and the Household Budget Survey to investigate the relationship between formalization, firm productivity, and household welfare in Georgia.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Survey", "Household Budget Survey"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) and Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS) to examine the relationship between maternal education and child health outcomes in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO), we explore the patterns of inequality in rural India across a range of dimensions, including income, education, and access to basic services.", "dataset": ["National Sample Survey Office (NSSO)"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "This research uses data from the World Values Survey and European Values Study to test hypotheses about individual-level and country-level determinants of political trust in Europe.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Values Study"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC) and the Global Financial Inclusion database to assess the impact of financial inclusion on economic growth in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Millennium Challenge Corporation (MCC)", "Global Financial Inclusion database"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "To examine the role of social media in the 2016 U.S. presidential election, we draw on data from Twitter Firehose, Facebook Ad Library, and Google Trends.", "dataset": ["Twitter Firehose", "Facebook Ad Library", "Google Trends"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) and the World Bank, we investigate the relationship between tourism, economic growth, and social sustainability in Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO)", "World Bank"], "topic": ["Tourism", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We use publicly available data from the International Trade Centre (ITC) and Eurostat to explore the patterns of trade in goods and services between the EU and China.", "dataset": ["International Trade Centre (ITC)", "Eurostat"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on data from the Global Findex database and the Gallup World Poll, we analyze the determinants of financial self-efficacy and financial literacy across countries.", "dataset": ["Global Findex database", "Gallup World Poll"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Health Organization (WHO) and the Global Burden of Disease study, we evaluate the health impact of air pollution in urban areas of South Africa.", "dataset": ["World Health Organization (WHO)", "Global Burden of Disease study"], "topic": ["Health", "Urban Development"]}]
